activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kal William Beeler

records.addlTxt:
Activity:  Arraingment   
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:30 PM Defendant Kal William Beeler appeared by phone.  Attorney David S Olson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lane Fitzgerald appeared by video for Kal William Beeler. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kal William Beeler appeared by phone.  Attorney Lane Fitzgerald appeared by video for Kal William Beeler. Defense stipulates to Defendants identity. Deputy Brandon Davis sworn in and testified by video. Court takes Judicial Notice of 12CF1215. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kal William Beeler appeared by phone.  Attorney Lane Fitzgerald appeared by video for Kal William Beeler. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:12 PM Defendant Kal William Beeler in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz also appearing by video.  David S Olson  appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with standard conditions and additional conditions of  No contact directly or indirectly with Darrell Stone, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Possess no weapons.  Not possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription,  Not possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
